channel.title: A Level course to replace Maths
channel.description:
I've decided to drop maths, as it is way too advanced for me, and I hate it. It isn't worth me getting a U at A-Level maths when I could get an A in another subject.
I want to study Computer Science at University but don't know what other subject to take. I am currently doing:
Applied ICT English Language + Literature Business Studies Maths
I don't really know what to replace Maths with. What would be beneficial for me and my future?
I'll think about all the suggestions I get. I really need help as the deadline for changing courses is looming...

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Ok, went with History. Interesting, and not boring.

Thanks for the help guys. Apprec.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can’t go wrong with history. I love it. (though it won’t really help you in the computer field)

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Yeh, cause its a real artistic achievement getting that award. I like using a computer for “art”, but not by hand.

Psychology is available, and apparently it’s really interesting. I’m torn between History and Psychology.

Read full topic
item.source: A Level course to replace Maths

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:3, topic:230385”]Never. I’ve always hated Arts.[/quote]Yet you had a graphics master award, ironic, isn’t it?[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:230490”]Chemistry[/quote]Rifk, chemistry sucks assssssss. Mr.Chris, if I were you, I’d take psychology if it’s available. It’s not very hard and even if all your other future plans fail you can always become a psychiatrist/psychologist.

Read full topic
item.source: A Level course to replace Maths

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Either stick with maths or take up AS Computing.

Physics will be too hard if you struggle with Maths.

Read full topic
item.source: A Level course to replace Maths

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Generally computing at university level requires a decent grade in a mathematical based subject - most of them will take applied maths/“use of maths”… might be work checking if your college does use of maths, it’s boring as hell but at least its easy, which seems to be what you’re aiming for.

EIther that or just pay attention in class and don’t fail it. shrug

Read full topic
item.source: A Level course to replace Maths

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:6, topic:230385”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=303299.msg2432855#msg2432855 date=1220996892]
In the Computer Science major that I am taking […]
[/quote]I thought you were out of college?[/quote]

I graduate with a bachelors degree in Computer Science in may (hopefully :P)

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:7, topic:230385”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=303299.msg2432855#msg2432855 date=1220996892]
In the Computer Science major that I am taking math is required up to calculus, I was fine up to that but just barely squeezed by calculus 2, which is truly a bitch. If you want Computer Science then chances are you have to take math as well, they are very related.
[/quote]

Yeh, I realised that after a long conversation with my tutor.

I take it there are plenty of other courses in IT, other than Computer Science, that don’t require a Maths A-Level. If not - I’m fucked.[/quote]

I would say most require fairly high math, it’s definitely something to look into. Your best bet would be to try your best to do math, even if it requires help outside of class and long hours of studying. Personally I hate nothing more than math, but it goes hand in hand with computers.

Read full topic

item.title: A Level course to replace Maths
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Moparisthebest:

In the Computer Science major that I am taking math is required up to calculus, I was fine up to that but just barely squeezed by calculus 2, which is truly a bitch. If you want Computer Science then chances are you have to take math as well, they are very related.

Yeh, I realised that after a long conversation with my tutor.

I take it there are plenty of other courses in IT, other than Computer Science, that don’t require a Maths A-Level. If not - I’m fucked.
